# beget_private_networks (Data Source)

List private networks available to the account

## Fields
- `id`: private network identifier
- `subnet`: base network address
- `mask`: subnet prefix length (CIDR)
- `region`: location where the network resides

## Filtering
Set `region` (e.g., `ru1`) to return only networks from that site. Omit the
attribute to list every private network in the project.

## Example Usage
```terraform
# Fetch every private network in the project
data "beget_private_networks" "all" {}

output "private_network_ids" {
  value = [for n in data.beget_private_networks.all.networks : n.id]
}
```
```terraform
# Filter networks by region
data "beget_private_networks" "ru1" {
  region = "ru1"
}

locals {
  first_ru1 = try(data.beget_private_networks.ru1.networks[0], null)
}

output "ru1_subnets" {
  value = [for n in data.beget_private_networks.ru1.networks : "${n.subnet}/${n.mask}"]
}

output "first_ru1_network" {
  value = local.first_ru1
}
```
<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Optional

- `region` (String) Region identifier that private networks must belong to.

### Read-Only

- `networks` (Attributes List) List of private networks matching the filter. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--networks))

<a id="nestedatt--networks"></a>
### Nested Schema for `networks`

Read-Only:

- `id` (String) Private network identifier.
- `mask` (Number) Subnet prefix length (CIDR mask size).
- `region` (String) Region where the private network resides.
- `subnet` (String) Base network address (without mask).
